32 This is an implementation of HMAC, the FIPS standard keyed hash function
33*/
34
35#include "hmac.h"
36
37#if defined(__cplusplus)
38extern "C"
39{
40#endif
41
42/* initialise the HMAC context to zero */
43void hmac_sha_begin(hmac_ctx cx[1])
44{
45 memset(cx, 0, sizeof(hmac_ctx));
46}
47
48/* input the HMAC key (can be called multiple times) */
49int hmac_sha_key(const unsigned char key[], unsigned long key_len, hmac_ctx cx[1])
50{
51 if(cx->klen == HMAC_IN_DATA) /* error if further key input */
52 return HMAC_BAD_MODE; /* is attempted in data mode */
53
54 if(cx->klen + key_len > HASH_INPUT_SIZE) /* if the key has to be hashed */
55 {
56 if(cx->klen <= HASH_INPUT_SIZE) /* if the hash has not yet been */
57 { /* started, initialise it and */
58 sha_begin(cx->ctx); /* hash stored key characters */
59 sha_hash(cx->key, cx->klen, cx->ctx);
60 }
61
62 sha_hash(key, key_len, cx->ctx); /* hash long key data into hash */
63 }
64 else /* otherwise store key data */
65 memcpy(cx->key + cx->klen, key, key_len);
66
67 cx->klen += key_len; /* update the key length count */
68 return HMAC_OK;
69}
70
71/* input the HMAC data (can be called multiple times) - */
72/* note that this call terminates the key input phase */
73void hmac_sha_data(const unsigned char data[], unsigned long data_len, hmac_ctx cx[1])
74{ unsigned int i;
75
76 if(cx->klen != HMAC_IN_DATA) /* if not yet in data phase */
77 {
78 if(cx->klen > HASH_INPUT_SIZE) /* if key is being hashed */
79 { /* complete the hash and */
80 sha_end(cx->key, cx->ctx); /* store the result as the */
81 cx->klen = HASH_OUTPUT_SIZE; /* key and set new length */
82 }
83
84 /* pad the key if necessary */
85 memset(cx->key + cx->klen, 0, HASH_INPUT_SIZE - cx->klen);
86
87 /* xor ipad into key value */
88 for(i = 0; i < (HASH_INPUT_SIZE >> 2); ++i)
89 ((uint32_t*)cx->key)[i] ^= 0x36363636;
90
91 /* and start hash operation */
92 sha_begin(cx->ctx);
93 sha_hash(cx->key, HASH_INPUT_SIZE, cx->ctx);
94
95 /* mark as now in data mode */
96 cx->klen = HMAC_IN_DATA;
97 }
98
99 /* hash the data (if any) */
100 if(data_len)
101 sha_hash(data, data_len, cx->ctx);
102}
103
104/* compute and output the MAC value */
105void hmac_sha_end(unsigned char mac[], unsigned long mac_len, hmac_ctx cx[1])
106{ unsigned char dig[HASH_OUTPUT_SIZE];
107 unsigned int i;
108
109 /* if no data has been entered perform a null data phase */
110 if(cx->klen != HMAC_IN_DATA)
111 hmac_sha_data((const unsigned char*)0, 0, cx);
112
113 sha_end(dig, cx->ctx); /* complete the inner hash */
114
115 /* set outer key value using opad and removing ipad */
116 for(i = 0; i < (HASH_INPUT_SIZE >> 2); ++i)
117 ((uint32_t*)cx->key)[i] ^= 0x36363636 ^ 0x5c5c5c5c;
118
119 /* perform the outer hash operation */
120 sha_begin(cx->ctx);
121 sha_hash(cx->key, HASH_INPUT_SIZE, cx->ctx);
122 sha_hash(dig, HASH_OUTPUT_SIZE, cx->ctx);
123 sha_end(dig, cx->ctx);
124
125 /* output the hash value */
126 for(i = 0; i < mac_len; ++i)
127 mac[i] = dig[i];
128}
129
130/* 'do it all in one go' subroutine */
131void hmac_sha(const unsigned char key[], unsigned long key_len,
132 const unsigned char data[], unsigned long data_len,
133 unsigned char mac[], unsigned long mac_len)
134{ hmac_ctx cx[1];
135
136 hmac_sha_begin(cx);
137 hmac_sha_key(key, key_len, cx);
138 hmac_sha_data(data, data_len, cx);
139 hmac_sha_end(mac, mac_len, cx);
140}
141
142#if defined(__cplusplus)
143}
144#endif
